result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Diederich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Diederich in court with attorney John E Voorhees. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping 946.49(1)(a); granted by the Court. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Defendant's Exh. 1 (letter w/signatures) marked, offered, received. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees statement to sentencing. Court statement. 

Court sentence
WHS
1 yr. POP concurrent with Dane Co.
CC/CV/Supervision
Comply with any court orders in place
DNA surcharge
Appeal Rights

3:16 p.m. Defendant Michael J. Diederich in court with attorney John E. Voorhees. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees state no testimony for hearing/stipulates to court reviewing complaint and attachments for making probable cause determination. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Michael J. Diederich in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:19
In receipt, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

01:41 pm - Defendant Michael J. Diederich in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
